Package com.teksystems.salestaxexercise.helpers

Class MoneyRoundingRule

java.lang.Object
com.teksystems.salestaxexercise.helpers.MoneyRoundingRule
public class MoneyRoundingRule
extends java.lang.Object
Helper class that can be used to round any Money object to a multiple of any arbitrary amount. (e.g. a multiple of 5 cents, a multiple of 2 dollars, etc.)
Author:
Andrew

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static java.math.BigDecimal ROUND_TO_MULTIPLE_OF_DEFAULT
    The default value to round to, if none is specified - 0.05.
    static java.math.RoundingMode ROUNDING_MODE_DEFAULT
    The default rounding mode used in this class.

  • Field Details

    • ROUND_TO_MULTIPLE_OF_DEFAULT

      public static final java.math.BigDecimal ROUND_TO_MULTIPLE_OF_DEFAULT
      The default value to round to, if none is specified - 0.05.

    • ROUNDING_MODE_DEFAULT

      public static final java.math.RoundingMode ROUNDING_MODE_DEFAULT
      The default rounding mode used in this class. If none is specified, is RoundingMode.UP

  • Constructor Details

    • MoneyRoundingRule

      public MoneyRoundingRule​(java.math.BigDecimal roundToMultipleOf, java.math.RoundingMode roundingMode)
      Constructor for instantiating objects of this class. Instantiated MoneyRoundingRules are basically just wrappers around around the static roundMoney(Money, BigDecimal, RoundingMode) function to allow you to store and reuse the same rounding rules over and over again with calls to round(Money).
      Parameters:
      roundToMultipleOf - the amount to which the input value should be rounded (if null, defaults to ROUND_TO_MULTIPLE_OF_DEFAULT)
      roundingMode - the rounding mode to use (if null, defaults to ROUNDING_MODE_DEFAULT)
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified amount we're supposed to round to is zero

  • Method Details

    • getRoundToMultipleOf

      public java.math.BigDecimal getRoundToMultipleOf()
      This rule will round input amounts to a multiple of this amount, never null.
      Returns:
      the interval amount to round to, never null

    • getRoundingMode

      public java.math.RoundingMode getRoundingMode()
      Get the rounding mode for this rounding rule. See RoundingMode for possible values
      Returns:
      the RoundingMode used by this rule, never null

    • roundMoney

      public static org.joda.money.Money roundMoney​(org.joda.money.Money value, java.math.BigDecimal roundToMultipleOf, java.math.RoundingMode roundingMode)
      Static function that can be used to round a Money object to a multiple of any arbitrary amount. (e.g. a multiple of 5 cents, a multiple of 2 dollars, etc.)
      Parameters:
      value - the Money object to be rounded (if null, will return null)
      roundToMultipleOf - the amount to which the input value should be rounded (if null or 0, value will be returned unmodified)
      roundingMode - to use (if null, defaults to ROUNDING_MODE_DEFAULT)
      Returns:
      a new Money object with a rounded amount, but the same currency as the input value

    • round

      public org.joda.money.Money round​(org.joda.money.Money value)
      Rounds the input money object. Just wraps the static roundMoney(Money, BigDecimal, RoundingMode) function, passing in the instantiated object's stored rounding settings
      Parameters:
      value - the Money object to be rounded (if null, null will be returned)
      Returns:
      A new Money object with a rounded amount, but the same currency as the input value.
